1.text: Bring 3-4 cups (750-1000 mL) of water to a boil in a pot on your stove.

2.text: Stir 1 cup (90 g) of Irish oatmeal and a pinch of salt into the water.

3.text: Reduce the heat to low once the water starts to boil again.

4.text: Simmer the oats, stirring occasionally, for 20-30 minutes.

5.text: Serve the oatmeal in individual bowls.

6.text: Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

7.text: Put 3.5 cups (875 mL) of water and 1 cup (90 g) of Irish oats in a slow cooker.

8.text: Stir in 2 tbsp (27.5 g) of brown sugar and 1 tbsp (7.91 g) of cinnamon.

9.text: Mix in 1  tsp (4.9 mL) of vanilla extract and 2 tbsp (28.4 g) of butter.

10.text: Add 1 cup (118 g) of peeled and chopped apple and 1/2 cup (79.5 g) of raisins.

11.text: Cover the slow cooker and turn it on to low heat for 6-8 hours.

13.text: Keep leftover oatmeal for up to 1 week in a sealed container in the fridge.

14.text: Put 1/2 cup (45 g) of Irish oatmeal into an 8 cup (2000 mL) bowl.

15.text: Add 2 cups (473 mL) of water to the bowl and stir the water and oats together.

16.text: Microwave the oatmeal on high for 10 minutes, stirring once halfway through.

17.text: Transfer the oatmeal to a serving bowl.

18.text: Sweeten Irish oatmeal with brown sugar or honey to taste.

19.text: Stir in a pat of butter or a splash of cream for extra creaminess.

20.text: Add classic dry toppings like cinnamon and nuts as you please.

21.text: Try sweet and juicy fruit toppings like berries and sliced bananas.
